Description: Part of a jar-seal: of pale brown clay, impressed with the repeated name of Djer. On the edge of this fragment is a trace of another impression. The clay is well preserved.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 30-1, 52, pls.XV, 106; XVI, 124 H. R. Hall, 'Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs etc. in the British Museum: Volume 1 : Royal scarabs' (London, 1913), 288, no.2 757; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964) , pls.8, abb.22; 13, abb. 29A; see also vols. I, 76 and II, 737, n.333; 1093, 1096; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 78.
